column4: Where is the network manager? in Ubuntu.  There is not signal ICON or anyting on my panel. I can create connections but I can't enable them from network-connections. How do I enable a network connection such as an already configured VPN connection.
you can try running "nm-applet" (NOTE: if you want to connect to wireless you might NEED GDM)
verify that you have gnome-indicator-applet in your toolbar
do you have indicator-applet in your menu?  Use "Add to Menu" to verify.
it looks like a speaker with a red X appeared along with an ICON of email
nm-applet warns that its already running and also warns it coulden't initialize the D-Bus manager.
try "killall nm-applet" then "nm-applet" from a terminal
what's is the icon to the left of teh speaker?
do you have network-manager-gnome installed?  verify with "apt-cache policy network-manager-gnome" in a terminal
well, I'm out of ideas, good luck.
nm-applet (i think we went over this?)
Nothing you've gone over was ever conclusive.
